main event: Several people noticed little curls of smoke on a lawn in West Rindge, N. H. on July 7, 1948, leading to the discovery of small burned spots, presumed to be caused by metallic fragments.
interesting points: There were multiple witnesses who reported seeing smoke and burned areas on the lawn., Metallic fragments found were similar to materials used in V-2 bombs., The investigation suggested that the fragments might be linked to a military jet turbo plane., The incident was noted by various authorities, including the FBI and Air Force headquarters., There was a possibility that the metallic particles were cast-iron, with an astronomical explanation ruled out.
witness description: A male civilian, possibly a retired security officer, involved in local observation and reporting.
